Sanha Cheong
nerd.from.birth / physicist.in.training

I am a Physics PhD student at Stanford University, studying experimental particle physics and cosmology. Currently, I work on the ATLAS experiment at the SLAC Group. More generally, I am interested in the intersection of particle physics and cosmology, the interface between theories and experiments, the applications of deep learning and other novel algorithms in physics, and artificial intelligence. I am also very passionate about physics education and career counseling.

Outside of physics, I spend time writing, playing and watching basketball, playing around with non-physical datasets, and (most importantly) sleeping.

테스팅용 한국어 (Korean) 문단입니다. 한글에는 "Noto Sans Korean" 가 적용돼있고, 영어 폰트는 기존의 것과 같습니다.

Before coming to Stanford, I did my undergraduate at University of Rochester. I graduated in May 2017 with a B.S. in Physics & Astronomy with Highest Distinction and a B.A. in Mathematics. As an undergrad, I worked with Prof. Regina Demina on cosmological data analysis research, preparing for the DESI project.
